Vast Empire

Govinda III is considered one of the greatest military victors of the Rashtrakuta dynasty. His horses were said to have drunk water from the 'Himalayas to Kanyakumari'. His empire stretched from Kannauj in the north to Kanchipuram in the south.

тЪФя╕П
Northern and Southern Conquests

He intervened again in the Tripartite Struggle and defeated the Pratihara king Nagabhatta II and the Pala king Dharmapala. In the south, he destroyed the confederacy of Pallava, Pandya, Chera, and Ganga kings.

ЁЯСС
Titles

He held titles such as 'Jagatunga' (Prominent in the World), 'Kiritavarsha', 'Prabhuta-varsha', and 'Shri Vallabha'. The king of Lanka also accepted his suzerainty and gifted him two idols.
